solution.text:
The surface area of the box \(= 2 (21 \times 10 + 10 \times 6 + 21 \times 6) = 792 cm^2\)
Cost of painting the box = Rs. 2.8 per \(cm^2\)
Therefore, total cost of painting the box = \(792 \times 2.8\)
= Rs. 2217.6

content.text: Latika needs to paint a rectangular box from the outside. The cost of painting the box is Rs. 2.8 per \(cm^2.\) If the dimensions of the box are \(21 cm \times 10 cm \times 6 cm\), what is the total cost of painting the box?

hint.text: Start by calculating the surface area

content.text: The dimensions of a cuboid are in the ratio of 6:5:2 (l:b:h). If the total surface area is 1664 \(m^2\). What is the length of the cuboid?
What is the Breadth of the cuboid?

solution.text:
Let length:breadth:height = 6x:5x:2x
Therefore, Surface Area of the cuboid = \(2(6 \times 5x^2 + 5 \times 2x^2 + 2 \times 6x^2)\)
= \(2(52)x^2\)
= \(104x^2\)
Given that surface area is \(1664 m^2\)
Therefore, \(1664 m^2 = 104 x^2\)
\(\Rightarrow x^2 = \frac{1664}{104}\)
\(\Rightarrow x = \sqrt{16}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) x = 4 metres

content.text: What is the Height of the cuboid?

hint.text: Surface Area of the cuboid = \(2 (lb + bh + lh)\)

solution.text:
Total surface area \(= 6 \times 12^2 = 6 (side)^2\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Length of side = \((\frac {864}{6})^{\frac 12} = 12 cm\)

content.text: A closed box in the shape of a cube has a total outer surface area of 864 \(cm^2.\) What is the length of its side in centimetres?

hint.text: Remember that surface area of a cube is \(6 \times side^2\)

solution.text:
Area of tin sheet required for 1 box = Surface area of one box
\(= 2 (7 \times 8 + 8 \times 6 + 7 \times 6) = 292 cm^2\)
Therefore, area of tin required for 11 boxes \(= 292 \times 11\)
\(= 3212 cm^2\)

content.text: You need to create a tin box of dimensions \(7 cm \times 8 cm \times 6 cm.\) What is the area of a sheet of tin required to make 11 such tins?

hint.text: Start by calculating the surface area of the box

solution.text:
Curved Surface area of the roller \(= 2 \pi rh = 2\pi \times \frac {5}2 \times 31 = 487.14 cm^2\)
Area covered per rotation \(= 487.14 cm^2\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Area painted in 55 rolls \(= 487.14 \times 55 = 26792.86 cm^2\)

content.text: Last Monday, Ram painted a rectangular wall with a cylindrical paint roller. The length of the roller is 31 cm and its diameter is 5 cm. While painting, the roller rolled over 55 times completely. What surface area did Ram paint?

hint.text: How much area does the roller cover in one rotation?

solution.text:
Total surface area of all the cubes \(= 5 \times 6 \times 1.6^2 = 76.8 cm^2\)
Area of each face =\(1.6^2 cm^2 = 2.56 cm^2\)
Number of faces that face inward = 10 faces
Therefore, outer surface area = 76.8 - 25.6 = 51.2 \(cm^2\)
Cost of paint = Rs 7 per \(cm^2\)
Therefore, total cost of painting the object = \(51.2 \times 7\)
= Rs. 358.4

solution.text: Surface Area of a cuboid = \(2(ab + bc + ca) = 2 (648 + 216 + 432) = 2592 dm^2\)

content.text: See the cuboid below, a=36 dm, b=18 dm, c=12 dm, Find its surface area

solution.text: Surface Area of a cylinder = \(2 \times \pi \times r \times(r + h) = 1617 cm^2\)

content.text: In the cylinder below, diameter=21 cm, h=14 cm, find its surface area

solution.text:
Surface Area = Curved surface area of outer cylinder + Curved surface area of inner cylinder + Area of both rims
\(= 2\pi {r_ o}h + 2\pi {r_ i}h + 2\pi ({r_ o}^2 - {r_ i}^2)\)
\(= 792 + 528 + 125.71 = 1445.71 cm^2\)
